intro: Aria callophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and spiny, woody stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. Aria callophylla is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
